summary: OLDSMOBILE DELTA 88, 1998 63000 MILES "COOLANT TEMPERATURE WARNING" LIGHT CAME UP  WHILE I WAS DRIVING ON HIGHWAY. I DROVE ABOUT 1/2 MILE TO THE SERVICE AREA. TURNED OFF THE ENGINE. WHITE SMOKE EXPELLED OUT OF EXHAUST PIPE, A SMOKE ODOR WAS INSIDE OF THE CAR.  TURNED  THE ENGINE  ON 10 MINUTES LATER.  THERE WAS COMPLETE SILENCE.  THE ENGINE GOT LOCKED UP BECAUSE A COOLANT LEAKED INTO THE ENGINE FROM THE UPPER PLASTIC INTAKE PLENUM. THE ENGINE WAS REPLACED.  IT IS A COMMON PROBLEM FOR 1995-2000  GM 3800 VIN K ENGINES.
